org.chronos.chronodb.internal.api

Interface ChronoDBConfiguration

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.chronos.common.configuration.ChronosConfiguration
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChronoDBConfigurationImpl

    public interface ChronoDBConfiguration
extends org.chronos.common.configuration.ChronosConfiguration
    This class represents the configuration of a single ChronoDB instance.

        static final java.lang.String STORAGE_BACKEND
        The storage backend determines which kind of backend a ChronoDB is writing data to.

        Depending on this setting, other configuration elements may become necessary.

        Type: string
        Values: all literals in ChronosBackend (in their string representation)
        Default: none (mandatory setting)
        Maps to: getBackendType()

      • STORAGE_BACKEND_CACHE

        static final java.lang.String STORAGE_BACKEND_CACHE
        Sets the maximum size of the cache managed by the storage backend (in bytes).

        Not all storage backends support this property.

        Type: long
        Default: 209715200 bytes (200MB)
        Maps to: getStorageBackendCacheMaxSize()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CACHING_ENABLED

        static final java.lang.String CACHING_ENABLED
        Determines if regular entry caching is enabled or not.

        This allows to enable/disable caching without touching the actual CACHE_MAX_SIZE.

        Type: boolean
        Default: false
        Maps to: isCachingEnabled()

        See Also:

        static final java.lang.String CACHE_MAX_SIZE
        The maximum number of elements in the entry cache.

        Type: int
        Default: none; needs to be assiged if CACHING_ENABLED is set to true.
        Maps to: getCacheMaxSize()

      • QUERY_CACHE_ENABLED

        static final java.lang.String QUERY_CACHE_ENABLED
        Determines if the query cache is enabled or not.

        This allows to enable/disable the query cache without touching hte actual QUERY_CACHE_MAX_SIZE.

        Type: boolean
        Default: false
        Maps to: isIndexQueryCachingEnabled()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • QUERY_CACHE_MAX_SIZE

        static final java.lang.String QUERY_CACHE_MAX_SIZE
        The maximum number of query results to cache.

        Please note that the amount of RAM consumed by this cache is determined by the number of results per cached query. Very large datasets tend to produce larger query results, which lead to increased RAM consumption while staying at the same number of cached queries.

        Type: integer
        Default: 0
        Maps to: getIndexQueryCacheMaxSize()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ASSUME_CACHE_VALUES_ARE_IMMUTABLE

        static final java.lang.String ASSUME_CACHE_VALUES_ARE_IMMUTABLE
        Enables or disables the assumption that user-provided values in the entry cache are immutable.

        Setting this value to "true" will enhance the performance of the cache in terms of runtime, but may lead to data corruption if the values returned by tx.get(...) or tx.find() will be modified by application code. By default, this value is therefore set to "false".

        Type: boolean
        Default value: false
        Maps to: isAssumeCachedValuesAreImmutable()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENABLE_BLIND_OVERWRITE_PROTECTION

        static final java.lang.String ENABLE_BLIND_OVERWRITE_PROTECTION
        Enables or disables the protection from "blind overwrites".

        Blind overwrites are the temporal "siblings" of the "lost update" anomaly in regular ACID databases. A blind overwrite occurs when there are two transactions, T1 and T2, which modify the same key-value pair P. Let's assume that T1 has committed first, and T2 wants to commit. T2 never had the chance to read the value of P that T1 has just written. If we would allow T2 to commit, the value written by T1 would simply go unnoticed and be ignored. This does not mean that the value written to P by T1 will be "lost", as it is still present in the versioning system, but usually T2 calculates the new value of P based on the previous value, which would lead to wrong results. This setting is a protection mechanism against such anomalies. Whenever there are concurrent transactions that attempt to manipulate the value for the same key, only the first of these transactions will succeed in its commit, all other transactions will be rejected and their callers will receive a ChronoDBCommitException.

        Blind overwrite protection doesn't come for free and does have a performance impact for commits (not for reads). Only disable this protection if you are absolutely sure that the aforementioned scenario either can not happen in your use case, or is allowed to happen.

        Type: boolean
        Default value: true
        Maps to: isBlindOverwriteProtectionEnabled()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DUPLICATE_VERSION_ELIMINATION_MODE

        static final java.lang.String DUPLICATE_VERSION_ELIMINATION_MODE
        Compaction mechanism that discards a version of a key-value pair on commit if the value is identical to the previous one.

        Duplicate versions do no "harm" to the consistency of the database, but consume memory on disk and slow down searches without adding any information value in return.

        Duplicate version elimination does come with a performance penalty on commit (not on read).

        Type: string
        Values: all literals of DuplicateVersionEliminationMode (in their string representation)
        Default value: "onCommit"
        Maps to: getDuplicateVersionEliminationMode()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • WORK_FILE

        static final java.lang.String WORK_FILE
        The working file, i.e. the file to which ChronoDB is writing in ChronosBackend.MAPDB mode.

        Required when STORAGE_BACKEND is set to ChronosBackend.MAPDB, otherwise this setting is ignored.

        Sibling files and folders may also be created for secondary indexing.

        Type: string
        Values: any valid filepath in your file system
        Default value: none (mandatory setting)
        Maps to: getWorkingFile()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DROP_ON_SHUTDOWN

        static final java.lang.String DROP_ON_SHUTDOWN
        Controls if the database contents should be dropped upon database shutdown.

        This is intended primarily for testing purposes and may be ignored by some backends.

        Type: boolean
        Default value: false
        Maps to: isDropOnShutdown()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JDBC_CONNECTION_URL

        static final java.lang.String JDBC_CONNECTION_URL
        Sets the JDBC database connection URL when ChronoDB is operating in ChronosBackend.JDBC mode.

        Required when STORAGE_BACKEND is set to ChronosBackend.JDBC, otherwise this setting is ignored.

        Type: string
        Values: any valid JDBC URL
        Default value: none (mandatory setting)
        Maps to: getJdbcConnectionUrl()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JDBC_CREDENTIALS_USERNAME

        static final java.lang.String JDBC_CREDENTIALS_USERNAME
        Sets the username in the JDBC credentials when ChronoDB is operating in ChronosBackend.JDBC mode.

        Optional when STORAGE_BACKEND is set to ChronosBackend.JDBC, otherwise this setting is ignored.

        Type: string
        Default value: none
        Maps to: getJdbcCredentialsUsername()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JDBC_CREDENTIALS_PASSWORD

        static final java.lang.String JDBC_CREDENTIALS_PASSWORD
        Sets the password in the JDBC credentials when ChronoDB is operating in ChronosBackend.JDBC mode.

        Optional when STORAGE_BACKEND is set to ChronosBackend.JDBC, otherwise this setting is ignored.

        Type: string
        Default value: none
        Maps to: getJdbcCredentialsPassword()

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • isDebugModeEnabled

        boolean isDebugModeEnabled()
        Returns true if debug mode is enabled, otherwise false.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.debug"

        Returns:
        true if debug mode is enabled, otherwise false.

      • getBackendType

        ChronosBackend getBackendType()
        Returns the type of backend this ChronoDB instance is running on.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.storage.backend"

        Returns:
        The backend type. Never null.

      • getStorageBackendCacheMaxSize

        long getStorageBackendCacheMaxSize()
        Returns the maximum size of the cache maintained by the storage backend in bytes.

        Not all backends support this property and may choose to ignore this option.

        Returns:
        The maximum size of the storage backend cache in bytes. Must not be negative.

      • isCachingEnabled

        boolean isCachingEnabled()
        Returns true if caching is enabled in this ChronoDB instance.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.cache.enabled"

        Returns:
        true if caching is enabled, otherwise false.

      • getCacheMaxSize

        java.lang.Integer getCacheMaxSize()
        Returns the maximum number of elements that may reside in the cache.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.cache.maxSize"

        Returns:
        The maximum number of elements allowed to reside in the cache (a number greater than zero) if caching is enabled, otherwise null if caching is disabled.

      • isAssumeCachedValuesAreImmutable

        boolean isAssumeCachedValuesAreImmutable()
        Returns true when cached values may be assumed to be immutable, otherwise false.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.cache.assumeValuesAreImmutable"

        Returns:
        true if it is safe to assume immutability of cached values, otherwise false.

      • isIndexQueryCachingEnabled

        boolean isIndexQueryCachingEnabled()
        Checks if caching of index queries is allowed in this ChronoDB instance.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.querycache.enabled"

        Returns:
        true if caching is enabled, otherwise false.

      • getIndexQueryCacheMaxSize

        java.lang.Integer getIndexQueryCacheMaxSize()
        Returns the maximum number of index query results to cache.

        This is only relevant if isIndexQueryCachingEnabled() is set to true.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.querycache.maxsize"

        Returns:
        The maximum number of index query results to cache. If index query caching is disabled, this method will return null. Otherwise, this method will return an integer value greater than zero.

      • isBlindOverwriteProtectionEnabled

        boolean isBlindOverwriteProtectionEnabled()
        Checks if blind overwrite protection is enabled on this ChronoDB instance or not.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.temporal.enableBlindOverwriteProtection"

        Returns:
        true if blind overwrite protection is enabled, otherwise false.

      • getDuplicateVersionEliminationMode

        DuplicateVersionEliminationMode getDuplicateVersionEliminationMode()
        Returns the DuplicateVersionEliminationMode used by this ChronoDB instance.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.temporal.duplicateVersionEliminationMode"

        Returns:
        The duplicate version elimination mode. Never null.

      • isDropOnShutdown

        boolean isDropOnShutdown()
        Checks if the database contents should be cleared upon database shutdown.

        This is intended primarily for testing purposes and may be ignored by some backends.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.storage.file.drop_on_shutdown"

        Returns:
        true if the database contents should be cleared on shutdown, otherwise false.

      • getWorkingDirectory

        java.io.File getWorkingDirectory()
        Returns the working directory in which the persistence takes place in case of the file-based backend.

        This is essentially the immediate parent directory which contains the getWorkingFile().

        Returns:
        The working directory. May be null if file backend is not used by this instance.

      • getWorkingFile

        java.io.File getWorkingFile()
        Returns the actual file in which the persistence takes place in case of the file-based backend.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.storage.file.work_directory"

        Returns:
        The backend file receiving the database contents. May be null if file backend is not used by this instance.

      • getJdbcConnectionUrl

        java.lang.String getJdbcConnectionUrl()
        Returns the JDBC Connection URL to which this ChronoDB instance is connected.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.storage.jdbc.connection_url"

        Returns:
        The connection URL, or null if this ChronoDB instance is not connected via JDBC.

      • getJdbcCredentialsUsername

        java.lang.String getJdbcCredentialsUsername()
        Returns the JDBC Username to which this ChronoDB instance is connected.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.storage.jdbc.credentials.username"

        Returns:
        The username, or null if this ChronoDB instance is not connected via JDBC.

      • getJdbcCredentialsPassword

        java.lang.String getJdbcCredentialsPassword()
        Returns the JDBC Password to which this ChronoDB instance is connected.

        Mapped by setting: "org.chronos.chronodb.storage.jdbc.credentials.password"

        Returns:
        The password, or null if this ChronoDB instance is not connected via JDBC.
